message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, this paper examines how innovation affects firm productivity in the agriculture and food sector.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]},
{"sentence": "This study analyzes household survey data alongside remotely sensed data on land use to understand the impacts of climate change on smallholder agricultural production in Tanzania.", "dataset": ["household survey data", "remotely sensed data on land use"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]},
{"sentence": "We collected and analyzed primary dataset from 50 cooperatives in Rwanda and complemented it with secondary data from sub-Saharan African countries to identify the key determinants of competitiveness in the coffee value chain.", "dataset": ["primary dataset from 50 cooperatives in Rwanda", "secondary data from sub-Saharan African countries"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]},
{"sentence": "Using World Bank's Debt database and the Global Findex Database, this study examines the relationship between debt and financial inclusion among low and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Debt database", "Global Findex Database"], "topic": ["Debt", "Financial Inclusion"]},
{"sentence": "This research uses a unique mobile phone dataset covering more than eight billion calls and texts for the residents of Côte d'Ivoire to analyze the impact of digitization on social networks in developing countries.", "dataset": ["mobile phone dataset covering more than eight billion calls and texts for the residents of Côte d'Ivoire"], "topic": ["Digital Development"]},
{"sentence": "We combine precipitation data from satellite observation sources and meteorological stations with flood events data gathered through crowdsourcing mechanisms to create a new risk index for disaster risk management.", "dataset": ["precipitation data from satellite observation sources", "meteorological stations", "flood events data gathered through crowdsourcing mechanisms"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management"]},
{"sentence": "This paper analyzes administrative data and government surveys from Colombia to assess the effects of a comprehensive set of education policies on student performance.", "dataset": ["administrative data", "government surveys from Colombia"], "topic": ["Education"]},
{"sentence": "We use micro-level data on electricity consumption from households, firms, and industries, alongside official statistics from the urbanization rate and industrial production in Pakistan, to measure the long-run impact of infrastructure investment on energy demand.", "dataset": ["micro-level data on electricity consumption from households, firms, and industries", "official statistics from the urbanization rate and industrial production in Pakistan"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Energy"]},
{"sentence": "Using household survey data, we evaluate the economic costs of exposure to air pollution and resulting health problems for low and middle-income countries, complemented with air quality data from global satellite sensing platforms.", "dataset": ["household survey data", "air quality data from global satellite sensing platforms"], "topic": ["Environment", "Health"]},
{"sentence": "This study combines geo-referenced data on water management instruments at basin-to-global scales, provider-based household survey data, and remote sensing data on vegetation cover, to explore water scarcity and its implications on food security in Africa.", "dataset": ["geo-referenced data on water management instruments at basin-to-global scales", "provider-based household survey data", "remote sensing data on vegetation cover"], "topic": ["Water", "Agriculture and Food"]} ]

content:
